Title: Primal dual mixed finite element methods for indefinite advection-diffusion equations
Abstract: © 2019 Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics.We consider primal dual mixed finite element methods for the advection-diffiusion equation. For the primal variable we use standard continuous finite element space and for the ux we use the Raviart-Thomas space. We prove optimal a priori error estimates in the H1- and the L2-norms for the primal variable in the low Péclet regime. In the high Péclet regime we also prove optimal error estimates for the primal variable in the H(div) norm for smooth solutions. Numerically we observe that the method eliminates the spurious oscillations close to interior layers that pollute the solution of the standard Galerkin method when the local Péclet number is high. This method, however, does produce spurious oscillations when outow boundary layers are present in the solution. In the last section we propose two simple strategies to remove such numerical artifacts caused by the outow boundary layer and validate them numerically.
